subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
I tried an Ouija board once. My brother and I were given one by my
grandmother, who found it in her attic. After asking many questions and
getting all sorts of answers that ranged from gibberish to the totally
absurd, I think we decided there was something in our joint subconsciouses
that was making the planchette give the answers it did.

That may not always be the case, though. I think if answers of some sort
were given involving something that no one present would have the faintest
idea about, and they turned out to be true or valid, then it might
demonstrate spirit communication.

Zack

> communication from an actual, intelligent being and not just my own motor
> responses making he planchette move. It would have to be information that I
> have no knowledge of.
>
> If I could do that, and consistently, then I would be comfortable saying
> that I am actually talking to a spirit.
>
> The reason I have my doubts is that you have to be touching the planchette
> to get it to move. If it were an actual spirit, I would think that shouldn't
> be necessary. We all know ghosts can a do move objects.
>
> But this brings up another mystery - if the Ouija board is actual spirit
> communication, maybe there is a difference between the entities you can
> contact with it and your common ghost.
>
